main event: An unidentified aerial object was observed on 15 April 1952 in Corner Brook, Newfoundland, making a 180-degree turn and disappearing after being tracked for some time.
interesting points: The object was described as having a yellowish gold color and being round in shape., The observation was made by a newspaper reporter and other witnesses confirmed the sighting., The object was seen at a high rate of speed and made rapid turns., The reported length of observation was about 1/2 minute at a time., The source had just published an article debunking such sightings the day before.
witness description: newspaper reporter and two other men
